directions: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add carrots and onion. Cook and stir until onion is soft and translucent, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Transfer mixture to a slow cooker.
Layer lentils, tomatoes, vegetable broth, portobello mushrooms, rosemary, and bay leaves on top of carrots and onions.
Cover and cook on Low until vegetables are tender, 5 to 6 hours.
ingredients: 2 cups dry lentils, rinsed and sorted
4  portobello mushroom caps, cut into 1/2-inch slices
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
title: Healthy Lentil and Portobello Soup in the Slow Cooker
